alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 18 at 5:01PM EST until November 18 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Fayette County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Eastern Monongalia County in northern West Virginia... Tucker County in northeastern West Virginia... Preston County in northeastern West Virginia... Southeastern Marion County in northern West Virginia... * Until 600 PM EST. * At 501 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Ursina to near Grafton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 13 and 31. Locations impacted include... Uniontown, Kingwood, Parsons, Terra Alta, Davis, Thomas, Rowlesburg, Farmington, Newburg, Hendricks, Hambleton, and Brookhaven. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
